item.title: Havva add a quote by Edmund Burke
item.description: "A kind Providence has placed in our breasts a hatred of the unjust and cruel, in order that we may preserve ourselves from cruelty and injustice. They who bear cruelty, are accomplices in it. The pretended gentleness which excludes that charitable rancour, produces an indifference which is half an approbation. They never will love where they ought to love, who do not hate where they ought to hate." -- Edmund Burke

item.title: Havva add a quote by John Stuart Mill
item.description: "So long as an opinion is strongly rooted in the feelings, it gains rather than loses in stability by having a preponderating weight of argument against it." -- John Stuart Mill

item.title: Havva add a quote by John Stuart Mill
item.description: "A general State education is a mere contrivance for moulding people to be exactly like one another; and as the mould in which it casts them is that which pleases the dominant power in the government, whether this be a monarch, an aristocracy, or a majority of the existing generation; in proportion as it is efficient and successful, it establishes a despotism over the mind, leading by a natural tendency to one over the body." -- John Stuart Mill

item.title: Havva add a quote by Edmund Burke
item.description: "They never will love where they ought to love, who do not hate where they ought to hate." -- Edmund Burke

item.title: Havva add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Havva add a quote by Roger Zelazny
item.description: "There's no such thing as civilization. The word just means the art of living in cities." -- Roger Zelazny

item.title: Havva add a quote by Cheris Kramarae
item.description: "Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings." -- Cheris Kramarae

item.title: Havva add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Havva add a quote by Heraclitus
item.description: "The people must fight on behalf of the law as though for the city wall." -- Heraclitus

item.title: Havva add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "We must always take sides. Neutrality helps the oppressor, never the victim. Silence encourages the tormentor, never the tormented." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Havva add a quote by John Holt
item.description: "The idea of painless, nonthreatening coercion is an illusion. Fear is the inseparable companion of coercion, and its inescapable consequence. If you think it your duty to make children do what you want, whether they will or not, then it follows inexorably that you must make them afraid of what will happen to them if they donâ€™t do what you want. You can do this in the old-fashioned way, openly and avowedly, with the threat of harsh words, infringement of liberty, or physical punishment. Or you can do it in the modern way, subtly, smoothly, quietly, by withholding the acceptance and approval which you and others have trained the children to depend on; or by making them feel that some retribution awaits them in the future, too vague to imagine but too implacable to escape." -- John Holt

item.title: Havva add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "Some things have to be believed to be seen." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Havva add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Havva add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "It is the job of thinking people not to be on the side of the executioners." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Havva add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Live to the point of tears." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Havva add a quote by John Adams
item.description: "Facts are stubborn things; and whatever may be our wishes, our inclinations, or the dictates of our passion, they cannot alter the state of facts and evidence." -- John Adams

item.title: Havva add a quote by John Adams
item.description: "They shall not be expected to acknowledge us until we have acknowledged ourselves." -- John Adams

item.title: Havva add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Havva add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "How many legs does a dog have if you call the tail a leg? Four. Calling a tail a leg doesn't make it a leg." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Havva add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Havva add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Loyalty to country ALWAYS. Loyalty to government, when it deserves it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Havva add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Havva add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Havva add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "When we remember we are all mad, the mysteries disappear and life stands explained." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Havva add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Peace by persuasion has a pleasant sound, but I think we should not be able to work it. We should have to tame the human race first, and history seems to show that that cannot be done." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Havva add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The government is merely a servantâ€•merely a temporary servant; it cannot be its prerogative to determine what is right and what is wrong, and decide who is a patriot and who isn't. Its function is to obey orders, not originate them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Havva add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Havva add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Havva add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I have no special talents. I am only passionately curious." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Havva add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I want to know God's thoughts - the rest are mere details." -- Albert Einstein
